item.title: Football Manager 26 announced
item.content:encoded:
The "most immersive and visually rich Football Manager experience yet."

Publisher SEGA and developer Sports Interactive have announced Football Manager 26, the next entry in its football management simulation series following the canceled Football Manager 25. Platforms and a release date were not announced.

Here are the first details, via SEGA:

Football Manager 26 promises to take players on a journey to define their footballing destiny with our most immersive and visually rich Football Manager experience yet. The potential for storytelling is redefined by taking players closer to the heart of the beautiful game.

An early snippet of the elevated Match Day experience through the lens of the official Premier League license gives just a taster of what to expect following the move to the Unity engine.

This is just the beginning so stay tuned for further updates.

Watch the announcement teaser trailer below.

item.title: R-Type Delta HD Boosted launches November 20 in the west
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Day and date with the Japanese release.

Shoot ’em up remaster R-Type Delta HD Boosted will launch digitally for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam on November 20 in the west, day and date with its Japanese release, publisher Clear River Games announced. Physical editions will also be available for PlayStation 5 and Switch.

Here is an overview of the game, via Clear River Games:

Originally released in 1998 on PlayStation to great acclaim, the highly-acclaimed shoot-’em-up returns, remastered, reloaded, and looking razor-sharp, with updated high-definition visuals, a new opening movie, a remixed soundtrack, and a heap of quality-of-life features to bring the dark science-fiction gem to modern machines.

In the year 2163, having triumphed over the Bydo Empire, the R9 was recovered and stored within a space fortress orbiting Earth. Humanity breathed a collective sigh of relief, but this was short-lived when in 2164 unidentified objects fell from the sky, followed electronic weapons systems running amok, and culminating in an ‘annihilation unit’ stored alongside the R9 suddenly going berserk, descending to Earth and beginning a wave of destruction. To bring the situation under control, the prototype test unit “R9 Delta” is deployed—marking the beginning of a new battle against the Bydo.

Running in silky smooth 60 frames per second and with the option to dynamically switch between the original graphics and high-definition visuals at the start of each gaming session, R-Type Delta HD Boosted features numerous options and new additions catering to modern gamers. The much-loved soundtrack has received a refresh, with newly-arranged compositions from Masahiko Ishida (R-Type II), as well as USP (R-Type Delta) and Chris Hulsbeck (R-Type for C64 and Amiga). There is also an option to adjust the screen size, and multiple difficult settings alongside an all-new practice mode provide players the opportunity to hone their skills before facing down the Bydo Empire for real.

item.title: Snoopy & The Great Mystery Club announced for PS5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Due out on October 10.

Publisher GameMill Entertainment and developer Cradle Games have announced mystery adventure game Snoopy & The Great Mystery Club for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC (Steam). It will launch on October 10 for $39.99.

The physical standard edition will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC. A digital Deluxe Edition will also be available for all platforms for $49.99, which includes an exclusive “Joe Cool” outfit for Snoopy, two Red Baron mini-games, two Peanuts soapbox racing mini games, and 75 full-color comics available to read in game. A physical version of the Deluxe Edition will also be available for Switch exclusively at Target for $49.99. The downloadable content “Joe Cool Fun Pack” will also be available separately for $14.99.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via GameMill Entertainment:

About

Snoopy & The Great Mystery Club is an all-new mystery adventure game. Playing as Snoopy, you’ll use your wits to solve puzzles and uncover mysteries around town. Investigate the case of the missing football equipment, seek out ghostly music and more with the Peanuts gang!

Put on your detective cap and join Snoopy and the gang in an all-new mystery adventure packed with delightful charm, clever puzzles, and heartwarming friendships! Explore the town, solve challenging cases, and uncover hidden secrets—with help from the lovable Peanuts crew.

Whether you’re investigating missing kites or seeking out the mysterious Lake Ness Monster, each case is filled with brain-teasing challenges and unexpected surprises. Build a team of four with friends like Peppermint Patty, Lucy, Marcie, Schroeder, Franklin and others—each bringing their own special skills to the case. Lighthearted, witty, and full of classic Peanuts charm, this feel-good action-puzzle adventure is perfect for players of all ages!

Key Features

  • Play as Snoopy – Snoopy’s on the case! Take charge of the Great Mystery Club and team up with the Peanuts gang, using their quirky strengths to help you solve puzzles.
  • Explore Iconic Locations – Visit the school, the iconic music hall, Charlie Brown’s house, the baseball field, the Kite-Eating Tree, and more on your hunt for the truth!
  • Snoopy’s on the Case – Switch between Snoopy’s personas—Detective, Beagle Scout, Fierce Pirate and more—to solve puzzles with clever tools like a leaf blower, a super-sleuth’s magnifying glass, a trusty metal detector and others.
  • Mystery Club Mini-Games – Have a blast with baseball, football, crafting, memory tests, object hunts, piano playing, and Snoopy soapbox racing —and take flight in the legendary Sopwith Camel to chase down the Red Baron!
  • A Story Packed With Heart and Humor – Enjoy humorous and delightful encounters in an emotional story that celebrates the power of friendship, teamwork, and staying true to who you are.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Thai folklore horror adventure game Kumarn: The Wandering Spirit announced for consoles, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Playable at Gamescom 2025.

Thailand-based WereBuff Studio has announced Kumarn: The Wandering Spirit, a horror adventure game inspired by Little Nightmares and rooted in Thai folklore. It will launch first for PC via Steam, followed by unspecified console versions at a later date. A release date was not announced. It will be playable at the Thai Pavilion at Gamescom 2025, which will run from August 20 to 24 in Cologne, Germany.

Here is an overview of the game, via WereBuff Studio:

About

Once sacred, now lost.

Kumarn: The Wandering Spirit is a dark and atmospheric horror adventure inspired by chilling Thai folklore. You play Kumarn, a childlike spirit once worshipped at a village shrine, now torn from his sacred home and cast into a haunting world of restless ghosts and cursed places.

With your loyal zebra companion, journey through forgotten temples, haunted villages and forsaken graveyards to rediscover where you truly belong.

Terrifying Thai Tale

Ghost stories you once heard now breathe in the dark.

Every spirit has a story—now you’re part of it. They mourn, they hunger, they hunt.

And now… they’re waiting for you.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Survive and Escape

Use stealth and environmental puzzle-solving to outsmart the deadly spirits that haunt your path. Every step is a test of timing, precision, and courage to escape.

Key Features

  • Explore the Spirit World – Journey through six chilling chapters inspired by Thai temples, shrines, graveyards, and haunted villages.
  • Cultural Horror, Reimagined – Encounter iconic Thai ghosts like Mae Nak, Phi Ta Khon and Krasue, brought to life with modern horror design.
  • Stealth and Puzzle Mechanics – Hide, think, sneak and run as you make your way through deadly encounters while solving environmental puzzles along the way.
  • A Mystical Companion – Team up with Zeb, a sacred zebra spirit that will guide Kumarn and help him survive the dangers that lurk around every corner.
  • Minimalist Storytelling – Atmospheric design and haunting visuals deliver emotion and lore without relying on heavy dialogue.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Forge of the Fae to be published by Deck13 Spotlight
item.content:encoded:
Chained Echoes and CrossCode publisher Deck13 Spotlight will publish Datadyne-developed RPG Forge of the Fae when it launches for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam in 2027, the company announced.

“Forge of the Fae is a perfect match for us,” said Deck13 Spotlight head of product Michael Hoss in a press release. “Even in its early stages it is incredibly well crafted and pulls all the right triggers. Working with Datadyne over the last couple of weeks also showed us what an amazing team is building this masterpiece.”

Datadyne’s David Schooley added, “We have found a reliable partner with Deck13 Spotlight. Not only do they fully understand the vision of the game but they also know the JRPG market so well. We are super excited for the upcoming journey!”

Here is a brief overview of the game, via Deck13 Spotlight:

About

Set in a world inspired by 1800s Ireland, Forge of the Fae plunges players into a beautifully crafted narrative where humans and fae are in conflict. As an ancient power awakens and tensions rise, players will follow the journey of Fiora, a young inventor, as she uncovers the secrets of her world while navigating a complex mystery and discovering who she can become. Decisions made will influence the outcome, giving players control over the story’s direction and creating a more personal experience.

Classic Turn-Based Combat and Puzzle-Solving

Drawing inspiration from classic JRPGs, Forge of the Fae features a deep turn-based combat system where strategy reigns supreme. Players will be challenged to master the “ARC Crystal System” and “Adrenaline” systems, which offer versatile, customizable spells and abilities, adding depth and excitement to combat. Alongside the action, intricate puzzles scattered throughout the world encourage exploration and reward players with powerful items and hidden lore.

A demo of Forge of the Fae will be playable at the Indie Arena Booth at Gamescom 2025, which will run from August 20 to 24 in Cologne, Germany, as well as at Tokyo Game Show 2025, which will run from September 25 to 28 in Chiba, Japan.
